subject: Re: [junit] When code refuses to be mocked
msgSnippet: ... Thanks for taking a look.  With apologies, that must have been a leftover experiment.  I changed it as you suggest, and the same thing happens. Updated:
messageBody:
On 11/12/06, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:

> If you look at this snippet from your wiki page, you should be able to see
> the problem more clearly:
>
> // set up the mock UniFile
> ctrlUniFile = MockClassControl.createControl(UniFile.class, null, null);
> mockUniFile = (UniFile) ctrlUniSession.getMock();
>
> // set up the mock UniSession
> ctrlUniSession = MockClassControl.createControl(UniSession.class, null, null);
> mockUniSession = (UniSession) ctrlUniSession.getMock();
>
> In the above snippet, you're getting the mock instance for both UniFile and
> UniSession classes from the same ctrlUniSession MockControl. You should ask
> the mockUniFile from ctrlUniFile instead.

Thanks for taking a look. With apologies, that must have been a
leftover experiment. I changed it as you suggest, and the same thing
happens.

Updated: http://wiki.wsmoak.net/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?SpringUOJ/Test

// set up the mock UniFile
ctrlUniFile = MockClassControl.createControl(UniFile.class, null, null);
mockUniFile = (UniFile) ctrlUniFile.getMock();

Result:
net.sf.cglib.core.CodeGenerationException: asjava.uniobjects.UniFileException-->
Cannot instantiate this object in this manner. Must use the UniSession object

Something inside UniFile just refuses to be instantiated except in
conjunction with a UniSession. :/ Does anyone see any other obvious
errors?

(If you're really bored, the UOJ Developers Guide is here:
http://publibfi.boulder.ibm.com/epubs/pdf/25124180.pdf
Chapter 4 has an overview of the API.)

Thanks,
--
Wendy
